snippet: Congress moved on two fronts Thursday to test the limits of presidential authority, including a surprising maneuver in the Senate to begin debating President Obama’s war powers against the Islamic State.
abstract: Congress advances on two fronts to test the limits of presidential authority, including a surprising maneuver in the Senate to begin debating President Obama’s war powers against the Islamic State and a vote in the House to stop him from using his executive action on immigration; moves are rare, if unplanned, shared view among liberals and conservatives.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: Congress moved on two fronts Thursday to test the limits of presidential authority, including a surprising maneuver in the Senate to begin debating President Obama’s war powers against the Islamic State.

headline.main: On War and Immigration, Obama Faces Tests of Authority From Congress
headline.print_headline: On War and Immigration, Obama Faces Tests of Authority From Congress
